member.name: T:VRDR.DeathRecord
member.summary: Class DeathRecord models a FHIR Vital Records Death Reporting (VRDR) Death Record. This class was designed to help consume and produce death records that follow the HL7 FHIR Vital Records Death Reporting Implementation Guide, as described at: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/vrdr and https://github.com/hl7/vrdr.

Class DeathRecord models a FHIR Vital Records Death Reporting (VRDR) Death Record. This class was designed to help consume and produce death records that follow the HL7 FHIR Vital Records Death Reporting Implementation Guide, as described at: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/vrdr and https://github.com/hl7/vrdr.

Class DeathRecord models a FHIR Vital Records Death Reporting (VRDR) Death Record. This class was designed to help consume and produce death records that follow the HL7 FHIR Vital Records Death Reporting Implementation Guide, as described at: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/vrdr and https://github.com/hl7/vrdr.

Class DeathRecord models a FHIR Vital Records Death Reporting (VRDR) Death Record. This class was designed to help consume and produce death records that follow the HL7 FHIR Vital Records Death Reporting Implementation Guide, as described at: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/vrdr and https://github.com/hl7/vrdr.

Class DeathRecord models a FHIR Vital Records Death Reporting (VRDR) Death Record. This class was designed to help consume and produce death records that follow the HL7 FHIR Vital Records Death Reporting Implementation Guide, as described at: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/vrdr and https://github.com/hl7/vrdr.

member.name: M:VRDR.DeathRecord.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor that creates a new, empty DeathRecord.

member.name: M:VRDR.DeathRecord.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor that takes a string that represents a FHIR Death Record in either XML or JSON format.
member.param: represents a FHIR Death Record in either XML or JSON format.
if the parser should be permissive when parsing the given string
member.exception: Record is neither valid XML nor JSON.

member.name: M:VRDR.DeathRecord.#ctor(Hl7.Fhir.Model.Bundle)
member.summary: Constructor that takes a FHIR Bundle that represents a FHIR Death Record.

member.name: M:VRDR.DeathRecord.GetDeathCertificateDocumentBundle
member.summary: Helper method to return the bundle that makes up a CauseOfDeathCodedContent bundle. This is actually the complete DeathRecord Bundle accessible via a method name that aligns with the other specific GetBundle methods (GetCauseOfDeathCodedContentBundle and GetDemographicCodedContentBundle).

member.name: M:VRDR.DeathRecord.GetCauseOfDeathCodedContentBundle
member.summary: Helper method to return the subset of this record that makes up a CauseOfDeathCodedContent bundle.

member.name: M:VRDR.DeathRecord.GetDemographicCodedContentBundle
member.summary: Helper method to return the subset of this record that makes up a DemographicCodedContent bundle.

member.name: M:VRDR.DeathRecord.GetIndustryOccupationCodedContentBundle
member.summary: Helper method to return the subset of this record that makes up a DemographicCodedContent bundle.

member.name: M:VRDR.DeathRecord.GetMortalityRosterBundle(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Helper method to return the subset of this record that makes up a Mortality Roster bundle.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.ActivityAtDeath
member.value:
the decedent's activity at time of death. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code
"system" - the code system this code belongs to
"display" - a human readable meaning of the code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> activity = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.ActivityAtDeathHelper
member.summary: Decedent's Activity At Time of Death Helper
member.value: Decedent's Activity at Time of Death.

example.para: Console.WriteLine($"Decedent's Activity at Time of Death: {ExampleDeathRecord.ActivityAtDeath}");

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.EntityAxisCauseOfDeath
member.summary:
Entity Axis Cause Of Death
Note that record axis codes have an unusual and obscure handling of a Pregnancy flag, for more information see http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/vrdr/branches/master/StructureDefinition-vrdr-record-axis-cause-of-death.html#usage>
member.value: Entity-axis codes

example.para: ExampleDeathRecord.EntityAxisCauseOfDeath = new [] {(LineNumber: 2, Position: 1, Code: "T27.3", ECode: true)};

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.RecordAxisCauseOfDeath
member.value: record-axis codes

example.para: Tuple<string, string, string>[] eac = new Tuple<string, string, string>{Tuple.Create("position", "code", "pregnancy")}

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertifierGivenNames
member.value: the certifier's name (first, middle, etc.)

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertifierFamilyName
member.value: the certifier's family name (i.e. last name)

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertifierSuffix
member.value: the certifier's suffix

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertifierAddress
member.value:
the certifier's address. A Dictionary representing an address, containing the following key/value pairs:
"addressLine1" - address, line one
"addressLine2" - address, line two
"addressCity" - address, city
"addressCounty" - address, county
"addressState" - address, state
"addressZip" - address, zip
"addressCountry" - address, country

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> address = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertifierIdentifier
member.summary: Certifier Identifier ** not mapped to IJE **.
member.value:
the certifier identification. A Dictionary representing a system (e.g. NPI) and a value, containing the following key/value pairs:
"system" - the identifier system, e.g. US NPI
"value" - the idetifier value, e.g. US NPI number

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> identifier = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.ContributingConditions
member.summary: Significant conditions that contributed to death but did not result in the underlying cause. Corresponds to part 2 of item 32 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.
member.value: A string containing the significant conditions that contributed to death but did not result in the underlying cause captured by a CauseOfDeathCondition.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CausesOfDeath
member.summary: Conditions that resulted in the cause of death. Corresponds to part 1 of item 32 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.
member.value: Conditions that resulted in the underlying cause of death. An array of tuples (in the order they would appear on a death certificate, from top to bottom), each containing the cause of death literal (Tuple "Item1") and the approximate onset to death (Tuple "Item2").

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.COD1A
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I, Line a.
member.value: the immediate cause of death literal.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.INTERVAL1A
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I Interval, Line a.
member.value: the immediate cause of death approximate interval: onset to death.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.COD1B
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I, Line b.
member.value: the first underlying cause of death literal.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.INTERVAL1B
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I Interval, Line b.
member.value: the first underlying cause of death approximate interval: onset to death.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.COD1C
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I, Line c.
member.value: the second underlying cause of death literal.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.INTERVAL1C
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I Interval, Line c.
member.value: the second underlying cause of death approximate interval: onset to death.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.COD1D
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I, Line d.
member.value: the third underlying cause of death literal.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.INTERVAL1D
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I Interval, Line d.
member.value: the third underlying cause of death approximate interval: onset to death.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.Residence
member.value:
Decedent's Residence. A Dictionary representing residence address, containing the following key/value pairs:
"addressLine1" - address, line one
"addressLine2" - address, line two
"addressCity" - address, city
"addressCounty" - address, county
"addressState" - address, state
"addressZip" - address, zip
"addressCountry" - address, country

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.ResidenceWithinCityLimits
member.summary: Decedent's residence is/is not within city limits.
member.value:
Decedent's residence is/is not within city limits. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code
"system" - the code system this code belongs to
"display" - a human readable meaning of the code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> within = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.ResidenceWithinCityLimitsHelper
member.value: Residence Within City Limits.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.MaritalStatus
member.summary: The marital status of the decedent at the time of death.
member.value:
the marital status of the decedent at the time of death. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code describing this finding
"system" - the system the given code belongs to
"display" - the human readable display text that corresponds to the given code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> code = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.AgeAtDeath
member.value: decedent's age at time of death. A Dictionary representing a length of time, containing the following key/value pairs:
member.para: "value" - the quantity value, structured as valueQuantity.value
"code" - the unit a PHIN VADS code set UnitsOfAge, structed as valueQuantity.code USE: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/vrdr/STU2/StructureDefinition-vrdr-decedent-age.html

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> age = new Dictionary<string, string>();
age.Add("code", "a"); // e.g. "min" = minutes, "d" = days, "h" = hours, "mo" = months, "a" = years, "UNK" = unknown

member.name: M:VRDR.DeathRecord.FromDescription(System.String)
member.summary: Helper method to return a JSON string representation of this Death Record. Redundant due to VitalRecord.FromDescription[RecordType], but kept to maintain backwards compatibility.
member.returns: a new Death Record that corresponds to the given descriptive format

member.name: T:VRDR.IJEMortality
member.summary: A "wrapper" class to convert between a FHIR based DeathRecord and a record in IJE Mortality format. Each property of this class corresponds exactly with a field in the IJE Mortality format. The getters convert from the embedded FHIR based DeathRecord to the IJE format for a specific field, and the setters convert from IJE format for a specific field and set that value on the embedded FHIR based DeathRecord.

member.name: F:VRDR.IJEMortality.trx
member.summary: Utility location to provide support for setting TRX-only fields that have no mapping in IJE when creating coding response records

member.name: F:VRDR.IJEMortality.mre
